name: DEPRECATED: Use of style sheets (JEE)

Avoid large Classes - too many Fields
Avoid large Interfaces - too many Methods (JEE)
Avoid declaring Instance Variables without defined access type
DEPRECATED: Avoid declaring Public Instance Variables
Avoid declaring Non Final Class Variables with Public, Protected or Package access type
DEPRECATED : Avoid declaring Final Instance Variables that are not initialized
DEPRECATED: Avoid using deprecated objects
DEPRECATED: Provide accessors to Private Fields
Collection interfaces should be used as method return types instead of their implementation classes
Collection declarations should use interfaces instead of implementation classes
Avoid hiding static Methods
Avoid using 'java.io.File'
Avoid using 'java.lang.System.getenv()'
Avoid using 'java.lang.Runtime.exec()'
Avoid using Exit and Halt Methods on a Web/Application Server

DEPRECATED: Proper overriding of 'clone()'
'super.finalize()' should be invoked when overriding finalize() method
Avoid instantiating a Boolean object
Avoid declaring an exception in the method signature and not throwing it
Classes and Interfaces must have JavaDoc Comments
DEPRECATED: Classes and Interfaces must have JavaDoc @author tag
Public Methods must have JavaDoc comments
Public Methods must have appropriate JavaDoc @param tags
Public Methods must have appropriate JavaDoc @return tags
Public Methods must have appropriate JavaDoc @throws/@exception tags
DEPRECATED: Public Methods must have appropriate JavaDoc @exception tags
Public Fields must have JavaDoc Comments
Avoid using 'System.gc' and 'Runtime.gc'
DEPRECATED: Avoid using 'System.err' and 'System.out' within a try catch block
DEPRECATED: Avoid using 'System.err' and 'System.out' outside a try catch block
Avoid using 'Throwable.printStackTrace()' with no argument
Avoid using Vector
Avoid using Hashtable

Avoid having package without enough Classes/Interfaces
Avoid having classes referencing Database objects
Package naming convention - case control
Interface naming convention - case control

Field naming convention - case control
DEPRECATED: EJB Entity access through their local Interface
DEPRECATED: EJB Session access through their local Interface
DEPRECATED: Struts action Mappings should have few forwards
Struts1: Avoid having Struts local forward with same name as Struts  global forward
DEPRECATED: Each method in an Action Class should have a small complexity

Struts Action artifacts should not directly call a JSP page
DEPRECATED: Action Classes should have only one public method
DEPRECATED : Avoid using  database objects from Struts Action Artifacts
Always have JSP pages referencing Java Objects associated to JEE Scoped Bean
DEPRECATED: JSP pages should always be accessed through their tiles definition
Avoid string interpolations to prevent SQL injections by using  PreparedStatement or CallableStatement
Avoid Fields in Servlet Classes that are not final static
Struts1: Avoid Struts Fields in Action Classes that are not final static
DEPRECATED : Private fields must have JavaDoc Comments
Struts1: Validate() Method of Struts Validator form must call super.validate()

Avoid large number of String concatenation (JEE)
Avoid String concatenation in loops
Avoid using '==' and '!=' to compare objects
Avoid the use of Instanceof inside loops
Avoid instantiations inside loops

Avoid calls between JSP Page for application using Struts framework

Avoid Packages with High Afferent Coupling (CA)
Avoid String initialization with String object (created using the 'new' keyword)
Call 'super.finalize ()' in the "finally" block of 'finalize ()' methods
Declare as Static all methods not using instance members
Provide a private default Constructor for utility Classes
Avoid cyclical calls and inheritances between packages
DEPRECATED: Avoid declaring Inner Classes
DEPRECATED: Avoid using Inner Classes
DEPRECATED: Avoid Struts action mappings validator turned off
Struts 1: Enable Struts Validator plugin
Struts 1: Avoid unused validation form

Struts1: Avoid Action Form Field without Validator
Ensure to override both equals() and hashCode()
Avoid non thread safe singleton
Avoid having suspicious similar method names or signatures in an inheritance tree
Avoid to use this within Constructor in multi-thread environment
Avoid Using Non-Serialized Beans with Session Scope
Avoid double checked locking for JSE 4.x and previous version
Lazy fetching should be used for Hibernate collection
Avoid UPDATE trigger firing when not necessary
Avoid Hibernate and JPA Entities using many-to-many association.
Persistent class method's equals() and hashCode() must access its fields through getter methods
Use table-per-subclass strategy when subclasses have many properties
Avoid Incorrect implementation of getters and setters for Collection Type
Use table-per-class-hierarchy when subclasses have few properties
Never use an array to map Hibernate collection
Persistent classes should Implement hashCode() and equals()
equals() and hashCode() should be defined for Hibernate/JPA component
Getter of collection-typed persistent attributes should return the correct interface type
DEPRECATED: Use only Hibernate API to access to the database
Avoid static Field of type collection
Avoid Hibernate Entity with 'select-before-update' set to true if not associated to table that fires an UPDATE trigger.
Prefer using version number instead of timestamp for Hibernate Entity
Avoid directly managing the connection to the database by using DriverManager
Avoid using catch blocks with assertion
Avoid an explicit call to finalize()
All types of a serializable Class must be serializable
Avoid throwing an exception in a catch block without chaining it
Avoid database tables associated to more than one Hibernate Entity
DEPRECATED: Avoid using DOM parser for large or medium sized XML file parsing
DEPRECATED: Avoid too many packages referencing Mainframe
Avoid logging using basic java log files
Avoid having Hibernate domain model depending on other Java APIs
Struts1: Only Struts HTTP Servlet should be used for Struts based application
Hibernate-provided implementations from third parties should be used for connection pool
All static fields in the enterprise bean class should be declared as final
Avoid table and column names that are too long (portability)
Avoid using session.setFlushMode(FlushMode.COMMIT, FlushMode.NEVER or FlushMode.MANUAL)
Avoid non serializable Entity beans
Avoid public/protected setter for the generated identifier field
Avoid using auto-wiring
Avoid defining singleton or factory classes when using Spring
DEPRECATED: Avoid too many EJB beans
Avoid using persistent class's identifier in equals() method
Overriden equals() Methods in persistent Subclasses should only reference properties from the persistent base Class
Avoid Struts Action Classes that call packages having direct access to database
Avoid thread creation for application running on application server
Always use declarative transaction
Avoid non validated inputs in JSP files that use JSF
Avoid using debug() method without calling isDebugEnabled() method
Never exit a finally block with a return, break, continue, or throw statements
DEPRECATED: Avoid using finalize()
Avoid accumulating Stateful Beans
Avoid EJBs using 'synchronized' qualifier, 'wait', 'notify' and 'notifyAll' Methods
Avoid indirect String concatenation inside loops
DEPRECATED:Avoid indirect exception handling inside loops
Avoid direct or indirect remote calls inside a loop
Avoid directly instantiating a Class used as a managed bean
Avoid unrestricted access to EJB remote methods
Struts 2: Avoid Struts Validator field without Form Field
Struts 2: Avoid Action Fields without Validation
Struts 2: Avoid unused validation form
Avoid testing floating point numbers for equality
Blocking synchronous calls should have associated timeouts
Avoid hardcoded network resource names (JEE)
Avoid missing release of SQL connection after an effective lifetime (JEE)
CDI Beans with normal scope must be proxyable to avoid runtime errors
Avoid operating on resource after expiration or release
Avoid using incompatible mutation
DEPRECATED: Content type should be checked when receiving a HTTP Post
Avoid using deprecated method, constructor, field, type or package
DEPRECATED: Avoid weak encryption algorithm as DES and triple DES
Avoid using RSA Cryptographic algorithms without OAEP (Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding)
